intro: Marcetella maderensis, commonly known as the Madeiran bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the island of Madeira. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky and sunny habitats, showcasing its adaptability to the island's unique environment. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Marcetella maderensis is an important component of the local flora and is often found in coastal and mountainous regions.
